definitions.text: to exercise in order to improve the strength or appearance of your body
examples: Huw works out in the gym two or three times a week.

definitions.text: to be the result of a calculation
examples: These figures work out differently each time I add them.
The safe load for a truck of this size works out at nearly 20 tons.
In fact the trip worked out cheaper than we'd expected.

definitions.text: to happen or develop in a particular way
examples: How is the new monitoring procedure working out?
Let's hope this new job works out well for him.

definitions.text: (of a situation) to happen or develop in a particular, esp. a satisfactory, way, or (of a person) to be suitable for a particular situation
examples: Is your new assistant working out OK?

definitions.text: to exercise in order to improve health, strength, or physical appearance, or to improve your skill in a sport
examples: I work out on my stationary bike.

definitions.text: to be successful or develop in a particular way
examples: I hope your new job works out.

definitions.text: to have a particular result or type of result
examples: These figures work out different every time I do them.
It works out cheaper to have the books printed in India.
work out at sth The unit cost works out at €11.25.
